page.title: 15EMPLOYMENT DOUNE
page.content: We asked householders in Doune to fill in a questionnaire so that we could find out{how many people {actually worked in the village itself {or the immediate area,}and to discover{how far people travelled.}As we expected, a very small percentage actually work locally. Most travelled to the following places daily, {Glasgow, Edinburgh, Dundee, Stirling and the other surrounding towns. Generally these were to electrical and chemical linked companies. We were surprised to find out that many men travelled from here to the North of England and all over Scotland to represent their firms. Some people work locally on the big estates of Moray and Argaty where they tend sheep and cattle. Most of the female workers find employment in Stirling and Falkirk or in local shops.
